borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<ol>
 
 
 
 
 
 </ol><p style="line-height: normal;">The
proposed two storey side&nbsp;extension&nbsp;by reason of its lack of
sufficient&nbsp;set back from the front elevation, width, massing, and bulk
would&nbsp;appear as an&nbsp;incongruous addition that is not sufficiently
subservient to the main dwellinghouse. In addition, the extension would result
in the closure in the distinctive gap between the host dwellinghouse and
neighbouring terrace row forming a cramped form of development, which would not
be in keeping with the spacing of the terraced blocks.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<o:p></o:p></p><ul><li style="line-height: normal;">Paragraphs 126 and 130 of the National
     Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF)
     (DLUHC, July 2021)<o:p></o:p></li><li style="line-height: normal;">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)<o:p></o:p></li><li style="line-height: normal;">Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework
     (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></li><li style="line-height: normal;">Policy&nbsp;BP11 of the Local Development
     Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></li><li style="line-height: normal;">Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6 of The London
     Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19
     Submission Version, December 2021)<o:p></o:p></li><li style="line-height: normal;">Paragraphs 5.4.1 and 5.4.2(a) of the
     Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document
     (February 2012)<span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,serif;
     mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"><o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ul>
description: Demolition of existing garage and construction of a double storey side extension and single storey rear extension.
